post.body: it was a necessity due to feeling run down. :)
well the hack didn't compromise the banking servers, they compromised their Network Solutions accounts and changed DNS!
the commenter has the gift of hyperbole.
the latest TD.NET solves my x64 problems. W00t!!!
heh heh. Like Stack Overflow!? Sure, but at least you started with the constructive part You didn't start with the bitching.
They're following you to convert you. Watch out! It's a trap! ;)
i'd be happy to let you detach your worldly possessions to me. the valuable ones, that is. ;)
really? how so? Yeah, silverlight might be a fun option for writing a game. Makes it easier to get it out there.
I've wanted to say those words so many times, but have held back thus far. ;)
goth night at your place every 3rd fri? stock up on black (windows live) mesh
electro goth?! that's new to me. with you on daft punk!
Whoa man, don't go too crazy now.
I love the new hat in your profile pic. I think we as a team should all wear them to work on Monday. ;)
well I broke 175 tests by changing some manually written code over to code gen. I fixed the code gen.
is the port in use because of a previous instance of cassini? If so, make sure the build kills any instances of cassini before.
i used to hate doing that in alaska. family got a snowblower *after* i left.
shovel it like a real man! ;)
No Nate, it *is* a big deal to me. I'm going to give myself 20 lashes for your pain. Have a nice weekend. ;)
maybe this'll teach you to do these crazy extensibility scenarios earlier in our product lifecycle. :P
but I see your point. Sucks that you have to re-implement this functionality.
crazy idea, what if instead of using an httpmethodconstraint, you used your own syntax for constraning it.
Ah! Because we do the validation in the setter. Doh! I guess we did that so you'd find out earlier.
Implementing RouteBase means you're tossing out everything about a Route and doing it yourself.
yeah, that's the downside. You could just inherit from Route and override everything you don't need. ;)
So you don't have to violate LSP and cast RouteBase to Route when you want to get Route specific properties. ;)
I think it's because Constraints are an implementation of Route and not RouteBase. It's a layer up.
And I use Mesh to synch my wife's computers as extra backup for photos.
No, I just have a Lacie 1TB file and a robocopy command.
If something worse happens, I'm covered. I've had times where both main and backup drives failed at the same time!
That's why I've combined Mozy with a local backup strategy. If a drive fails, I can restore quickly.
How much were you backing up? I have 79 GB backed up on Mozy?
I use Mozy. been happy with it so far. It's saved my butt once already.
i meant "too high". no drinks yet, just watching an 18 mo old inhale food right now.
bored? write some code! or read some. ;) subtext?
damn you brad wilson for setting the bar too hard. i'm still wearing jeans, but non ripped ones, maybe
I was unconsciously singing it last night and my wife gave me a very weird look.
I have an even worse song stuck in my head - SNL digital short: http://is.gd/aAik
I generally do it by method sig. You can pass in objects and have them populated by convention when posting forms, etc...
hey man, got a minute to call me?
a red bed? And that somehow doesn't make you a total chick? Does not compute. I was merely humoring Mike with that drink.
what is it? Review time over there? ;)
The more videos the merrier. I would never turn them down.
Do I want videos? As in you're going to create some for me? Sure!
it's not till the roads are painted white when chaos ensues. ;)
they still producing more issues. i thought they stopped. or was that Groo?
how is it? i was a huge fan of the comic book back in the day
i need eric kemp's help. download too big for vm
when i get unstuck from traffic. :)
wuit twittering and start subtexting. :p
I'm in total agreement. It only broke external behavior because of typos.
if I break unit tests, it just means I made a mistake in my refactoring by trying to do too many in one go. I'm fallible man!
check out http://geekswithblogs.net/
or is it that you just hate speaking to Americans. ;)
Ah, I didn't realize you were speaking at these conferences. Good for you! I know how you hate speaking...
Wow, that sounds like quite a tour!
yep, it's in our source tree.
I was just teasing. Nobody likes breaking changes when it doesn't make the product better!
aren't you supposed to love breaking changes?
Shouldn't you be focusing on driving and not twittering in traffic?
Great avatar man!
You better reach across the room and smack your officemate.
ha! That's too funny.
dude, chang your twitter icon. That one is played.
ha ha! Well, fortunately I think I understand the circumstances it was created in somewhat, so there's nothing but love for .TEXT :)
isn't Subtext really just one big endless refactoring project?
It shouldn't require 3.5 SP1, just 3.5. What error did you get?
heh heh. That tweet summarized the dilemma of my last blog post. :)
what pain? I thought you had no nerve endings.
christmas present for the family, or for you? :P
have a great trip!
send me an email. That would seem inconsistent if by adding a parameter to a method, suddenly your existing form post breaks.
anytime. g'nite! So I hope at least it's no longer an "abomination". :)
which is why we use the arg name as prefix by default. However, we've debated other approaches and welcome feedback.
right, but if you had an action method with 2 args, the form post values would intermesh...
Feeling refreshed after the gym. Maybe I'll go to sleep at a reasonable hour rather than stay up late coding on Subtext.
Spark gets better and better as i use it. It supports multiple content region templating, unlike many other templating engines I've seen.
What I want to know is how the heck they got those account names and passwords?
Regarding the last video, she's the one who taught me the CTRL Dot trick for expanding smart tags and squigglies.
Cool video of better support for Test First dev (using ASPNETMVC to demo) in VS10. Slightly old, but I hadn't seen it. http://is.gd/a7nF
Loved this 37 signals post: http://is.gd/9KAF Pick Discontentment with things you can change. Choose constructive action over just bitching.
Food for thought "Why hiring freezes are dumb" - http://ourworld.compuserve.com/homepages/gately/pp15s122.htm
regarding how Subtext uses NAnt to call MSBuild: @bradwilson says "That's like a Demeter violation for build systems." :D
I need to remember to close Tweetdeck when I'm done. My wife asked me about a weird "chirping" sound coming from the home office.
Really would love to find time to try out XNA and write my first game that's not a text-based choose your own adventure type game.
Getting bored with Twitter. Of course, Twitter is the place to report that useless tidbit. ;)
Stepping slowly away from Gears of War 2. The game is pretty dark...and awesome!
i could go for some egg nog rightabout now.
when is @shanselman going to write babysmash mobile
Thanks Cody for that last tweet. BabySmash Twitter edition.
e e qqqqqqqqqqqqq q bbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbb
Please wait while the features are configured. This might take several minutes... Or hours. Or days.
Whoo one fix brings me from 243 to 75 failed tests. Do you smell that? It's the smell of code.
ouch, 243 failing tests.
poor kid has a fever. i'd be upset too with a thermometer up my butt
Man I love OpenId now that more people are using it: Unfuddle, Subtext, SourceForge, StackOverflow, etc...
Whew! Finally finished the last chapter I'm supposed to write. I actually wasn't supposed to write that one, but picked up some slack. ;)
whoops, last question mark should've been a period. ;)
the guys got me the most ridiculously girly drink ever.
Holiday dinner for the ASP.NET team tonight. W00t.

The feedburner to Google changeover screwed up my RSS feed. GrrrR!!!!
With peeps talking about Balsamiq, tried and really liked it. Click the "Try it Now" button for instant trial w/o install. http://is.gd/wtn
Everyone seems to think I was the wasted one last night, but all the young 'uns here seem to be in pain this morning and I feel great!
Regarding last night's fruity drink, I think it was a Mai Tai, sans umbrella.
it's gonna be cold at morning pick-up soccer
bout to watch weeds season 3 on netflix. only watching
great conversation and wine w/ @migueldeicaza and... forgot twittername
Refactoring anti-pattern: Biting off more than you can chew. I should have run tests after each one, rather than after trying to do a set.
32 failures. I'll fix them tomorrow. g'nite.
Assuming my unit tests run.
Just completed a huge refactoring of Subtext's internal data access layer. Say goodbye to SqlDataProvider and DbProvider.
The default aggregate blog page for Subtext needs a serious coat of shiny paint.
Gonig to Sideline Sports tonight for drinks with my soccer teammates.
Is it just me or does Andy Samberg's singing partner in this SNL short look just like @lostintangent http://is.gd/aAik
RT @scottgal: waterfall outside MS building 42...chilly http://twitpic.com/tft5
I haven't tested it thoroughly, but it pretty much is just a recompile with no real changes.
BTW, I've recompiled Subtext 2.1 for ASP.NET 3.5 http://is.gd/bQoB Not an official release yet, but available for those who want it.
By the way, thanks for all the inspirational quotes. Yours are *actually* inspirational. Mine tend to be quite the opposite. I'll save them.
RT @scottgal: update... http://twitpic.com/t5qj Our new inspirational quote.
had dinner at Serafina. highly recommend. very good italian.
going out for some xmas dim-sum
I am so knee deep in a huge refactoring. Good thing this time, I'm running the tests often. All systems pass.
...the refactorings start to branch out into an immense refactoring. To decouple this, I need to change that. To change that, I need to ...
Best way to learn the benefits of SRP and low coupling/high cohesion is to refactor code that doesn't exhibit these proprties...
Merry Christmas! It's definitely a white one here. I hope our friends can make it over for our King Crab Christmas dinner tradition.
anyone lnow a good link checker. ideally automatable against localhost
I kid you not, non-spam comment left on my blog... "hi my name is mukura but i find girlfriend"
Showing Twitter to my dad.
Grandparents are the best things ever when you need a break. :)
Spent an hour debugging something only to realize I was calling an overload I hadn't implemented! Shoulda thrown a NotImplementedException!
Just donated some money to Wikipedia. http://wikimediafoundation.org/wiki/Donate/Now/en
looks like everyone braved the slushie road ti do holiday shopping in bell square
